summary:
Evangelicalism is a global Protestant movement focusing on sharing the "good news" of Christianity, called the Gospel. It emphasizes personal faith and conversion, often referred to as being "born again." This movement began in the 16th century during the Protestant Reformation and gained momentum in the 18th and 19th centuries.

Evangelicals believe in the authority of the Bible and can be found in various Protestant denominations, making up a significant portion of Christians worldwide. The United States has the largest evangelical population, with many famous leaders and preachers associated with this movement.
title: Evangelicalism
